main_definition: To maintain or hold something in a particular condition, place, or manner.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Maintained (often by force) as being under someone's control or influence.
meanings_and_examples.example: She was kept against her will on the island.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Having been cared for, looked after, or nurtured over a period of time.
meanings_and_examples.example: He was well-kept by his parents throughout childhood.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To keep (a record) as evidence or proof in case further action is needed.
meanings_and_examples.example: The police kept the fingerprints found at the crime scene.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Refusing to give up or surrender, holding on tightly or persistently.
meanings_and_examples.example: Despite numerous setbacks, he kept working towards his goal.
